title: Nigel Farage 'more optimistic' about Brexit now as he predicts Tory victory in the Commons
text:
Nigel Farage has said he is "more optimistic about Brexit" than he has been in a while, as he predicted the Tories could win a majority in the Commons if they campaign to leave the EU without a deal.

Writing in the telegraph.co.uk, Mr Farage says running an election on a “no deal” platform will help Boris Johnson "gain many votes" from the Brexit Party, suggesting a formal deal between the parties will not be needed.

Last night Downing Street would not rule out running a general election campaign on a no deal manifesto.

It followed a Number 10 memo, believed to sent by Mr Johnson’s chief of staff Dominic Cummings on Monday, which said: "To marginalise the Brexit Party, we will have to fight...
description: Nigel Farage has said he is "more optimistic about Brexit" than he has been in a while, as he predicted the Tories could win a majority in the Commons if they campaign to leave the EU without a deal.
